bug.author: Tockra
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h5>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
OpenCV =>master branch Operating System / Platform => Linux 9bfa02303e1e 4.4.0-109-generic #132-Ubuntu SMP Tue Jan 9 20:00:40 UTC 2018 ppc64le ppc64le ppc64le GNU/Linux Compiler => gcc 5.4 ? (I'm using the Makefile)
<denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
When I build cmake, I get the following error after 100% (It's new, before 7 days it worked correct): /usr/bin/ld: CMakeFiles/opencv_python3.dir/__/src2/cv2.cpp.o: In function pyopencv_cv_cuda_cuda_DeviceInfo_computeMode(_object*, _object*, _object*)': cv2.cpp:(.text._ZL44pyopencv_cv_cuda_cuda_DeviceInfo_computeModeP7_objectS0_S0_+0x10c): call to _object* pyopencv_from(unsigned int const&)' lacks nop, can't restore toc; recompile with -fPIC /usr/bin/ld: final link failed: Bad value collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status modules/python3/CMakeFiles/opencv_python3.dir/build.make:111: recipe for target 'lib/python3/cv2.cpython-35m-powerpc64le-linux-gnu.so' failed make[2]: *** [lib/python3/cv2.cpython-35m-powerpc64le-linux-gnu.so] Error 1 CMakeFiles/Makefile2:7500: recipe for target 'modules/python3/CMakeFiles/opencv_python3.dir/all' failed make[1]: *** [modules/python3/CMakeFiles/opencv_python3.dir/all] Error 2 Makefile:160: recipe for target 'all' failed make: *** [all] Error 2 <denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
git clone <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv.git>https://github.com/opencv/opencv.git</denchmark-link>
cd opencv/ mkdir build cd build/ cmake -D CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RELEASE .. make -j5

comments.comment: Okay sorry, I think the best idea is not to use the master branch ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Probably related: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/12234>#12234</denchmark-link>
Master branch should be able to compile successfully too. Mentioned symbol should be handled by this <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/12234/files#diff-89d22c654c2f89080be8b4f570671affR28>line</denchmark-link> . Unfortunately, we doesn't have native PowerPC build environment (only cross-compilation is checked), so we can't help here really. As a workaround you can disable Python bindings: cmake -DBUILD_opencv_python3=OFF ... /cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/seiko2plus>@seiko2plus</denchmark-link> Could you take a look on this?
So I don't have this problem anymore with the 3.4 branch. But I can test the commits of the last few days and tell you which commit broke it

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/alalek>@alalek</denchmark-link> , Yes exactly error caused after merge <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/12234>#12234</denchmark-link> , you can check following builds for more clarification. <denchmark-link:https://ocv-power.imavr.com/#/builders/3/builds/66>gcc4.9</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://ocv-power.imavr.com/#/builders/2/builds/2>gcc5.5</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://ocv-power.imavr.com/#/builders/7/builds/2>gcc6.4</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://ocv-power.imavr.com/#/builders/1/builds/2>clang-4.0.1</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://ocv-power.imavr.com/#/builders/5/builds/1>clang-5.0.2</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://ocv-power.imavr.com/#/builders/4/builds/1>clang-6.0.1</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Tockra>@Tockra</denchmark-link> , Please could you try <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/12452>#12452</denchmark-link> ? it should resolve this issue.
